subject: Travel
title: Vasco da Gama's Sea Route to India
description: A 60-second lesson on Vasco da Gama's Sea Route to India.

hook.text: For centuries, spices from India reached Europe through expensive Arab middlemen.

buildup.text: Portugal spent decades inching down Africa's coast, looking for a way around the continent.

discovery.text: In 1498, Vasco da Gama rounded Africa and reached Calicut, India, with four small ships.

twist.text: The Indian merchants laughed at his trade goods. Portugal's offerings were worthless to them.

climax.text: Da Gama returned with cannons. Portugal took the spice trade by force, not by commerce.

punchline.text: When trade failed, Europe chose violence.

quiz.question: What happened when da Gama tried to trade with Indian merchants?
options: They rejected his goods as worthless
